Event: Recent Epoch of geology begins; Ice Age ends; human beings spread to all parts of the world.
First Illuminatus, Gruad, rules in mythical Atlantis.
Mythical Lloigor inhabit continent of Mu.
Approximate beginning of agriculture.
Earliest estimated date of carving of the Crystal Skull found at Lubaantun in the Yucatan.

Estimated date of inscriptions on stone disks by the Dropa tribe, a diminutive people of the Bayan-Kara-Ula Mountains on the border of China and Tibet; disks describe how the tribe came to earth in flying machines; ancient Dropa graves contain human remains with huge heads and small bodies.
Fictional Hyborian Age in Europe.
Supposed date of Plato's Atlantis.
Picture-writing develops.
First alphabet begins to develop.
Approximate date of discovery of metals, beginning of cities, constellations of stars first recorded.
Egyptians begin placing small pieces of crystal on the forehead of deceased prior to mummification.
Trephination (cutting a hole in the skull) practised by people all over the world.
Approximate date of building of the Sphinx and Great Pyramid at Giza and other pyramids elsewhere in Egypt.
Beginning date of Olmec calendar from Central America.
Earliest parts of the Bible written.
Indus Valley civilization develops complex government, writing, and well planned cities.
Minoan civilization flourishes in Crete.
Sarmoung Brotherhood of Babylonia flourish according to Gurdjieff.
Egyptians record star configurations (decans) on which the 24 hour day is based.
Stonehenge and other stone circles built in England.
Huge 'Silbury Hill' Mound constructed at Avebury, near Stonehenge.
Babylonian Enuma Anu Enlil, early roots of astrology based on celestial phenomena.
Approximate date of the destruction of Thera, on which Atlantis legends are probably based.
Early references to Mithraism on cuneiform astronomical texts.
Quadrants of the moon recorded in China.
Akhenaten's (Son of Amenhotep III) monotheistic sun worship in Egypt.
Tutankhamun, Akhenaten's successor who revived polytheism, buried at Thebes; curse reading 'Death comes on swift wings to he who opens this tomb,' written on tomb doorway.
Approximate date I Ching written in China.
End of the Trojan War, Illium falls to the Greeks.
Huge Sacrificial Table built at Mystery Hill near North Salem, New Hampshire.
Legendary Thule civilization in the Gobi region destroyed by a catastrophe, 'possibly of an atomic nature,' survivors migrating to Agarthi and Schamballah.
Approximate date of building of Solomon's Temple in Jerusalem, traditional origin of the Masonic fraternity; alleged assassination of Temple master-mason Hiram for refusing to reveal masonic secrets.
Approximate time that settlers from Europe and the Middle East established colonies in North America.
Twenty-eight 'moon stations' in monthly lunar cycle recognized in Babylonia, India, and China.
Legendary founding of Rome by Romulus.
Jordanian city of Petra is carved out of sandstone by unknown culture.
Approximate beginning of money with first coins in Lydia.
Nebuchadnezzar completes building Tower of Babel in Babylon.
Sun Tzu's treatise The Art of War, first intelligence manual.
Time of Buddha, Lao Tse, Confucius, Zarathustra, Orpheus, Pythagoras, Zachariah, and Daniel - an Illuminated century.
Execution of Spurius Cassius in Rome.
Development of the 12 constellations of the zodiac in Mesopotamia, recognizing the importance of the plane of the elliptic through which the sun, moon, and planets move.
Assassination of Spurius Maelius; for plotting to be King of Rome.
Astrological ideas from Enuma Anu Enlil transmitted to India.
Druidism in England.
Approximate date Plato's The Republic written, featuring such Illuminoid images as the Philosopher Kings, the Divided Line, and the parable of the Cave.
Plato's Timaios and Kritias, earliest accounts of Atlantis.
Fabius family of Rome reaches its greatest heights.
Invention of Mayan calendar in Yucatan, based on advanced astronomy.
Approximate date Greek poet Aratus makes first systematic record of star constellations in Phaenomena.
Rule of Asoka, king of India who allegedly founded the Nine Unknown.
Archimedes uses burning-glass to set fire to Roman fleet at Syracuse, early use of lens as weapon.
Land reformer Tiberius Gracchus murdered and hundreds of his followers killed by followers of powerful Roman patricians; death of Scripio Africanus the younger a few years later.
Gaius Gracchus and 3000 of his followers massacred by patricians.
Essentials of modern astrology worked out.
The Great Teacher of the Essenes.
Approximate date of assassination of Saturninus and Glaucia.
Assassination of Rutilius Rufus.
Assassination of Livius Drufus.
Revolt of the gladiators led by Spartacus.
Assassination of Julius Caesar.

Birth of Jesus of Nazareth, accompanied by various Illuminoid trappings; three early Men-In-Black disguised as the Wise Men; strange lights in the sky; miracles such as visits from angels, prophecy and suspension of time are reported.
Carnation-Painted Eyebrows Society, Copper Horses, Iron Shins, and other secret societies active in China.

Assassination of the radical Jesus, allegedly on Illuminati orders; more Illuminoid trappings; an eclipse; an earthquake; visitors from the sky roll away the stone from the sepulcher and liberate the crucified Jesus.
Hero of Alexandria devises primitive steam-engine.
Simon Magus, Menander, Valentinus, and others develop Gnostic religious doctrines of esoteric knowledge (illumination).
Approximate date Ptolemy records 1,022 stars in Almagest; also recorded astrological ideas from Enuma Anu Enlil in his Apotelesmatika.
Roman Mithraism competes with Christianity.
Yellow Turban Society subdues northern China, Triad cult formed in opposition.
First book of the Kabbalah, Sefer Yetzirah, compiled.
Life of Mani, the Illuminator, who founded Manichaeism, based on ideas from Judaism, Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Gnosticism, etc.
Council of Nicaea in which Christian orthodoxy begins to rigidify.
Estimated date of carving of stone statues found on Easter Island.
Chinese use of gunpowder.
Life of Muhammad, founder of Islam.
Callinicus invents Greek Fire, primitive incendiary bomb.
Life of the Venerable Bede, the greatest scholar of Saxon England whose Ecclesiastical History of England (731) contained many occult and unexplained occurrences - an early Ambrose collection.
Sufi mysticism begins.
Fictitious Al Azif written in Damascus by Abdul Alhazred.
Charlemagne allegedly established Holy Secret Tribunal which becomes the Holy Vehm.
Ismaili and Fatimid missionaries throughout Islamic Empire preach revolution against the ruling Sunni order and 'Abbasid state.
Beginning of the Bogomils of Bulgaria, a Manichean sect, roots of Cathari.
First Fatimid caliph in Egypt.
Life of Pope Sylvester II who allegedly visited the Nine Unknown in India.
Al Azif translated into Greek as Necronomicon.
Abode of Learning active in Cairo.
Approximate founding of Yazidi cult by sufi Shaikh Adi in Iraq.
Leif Ericson explores North America.
Spread of Cathari Manichaeism throughout Europe.
Life of Hasan-e Sabbah, founder of the Assassins of Persia.
Approximate date of founding of the Order of Hospitallers in Jerusalem.
Member of the Abode of Learning sect gains temporary control of Baghdad.
Member of the Ismaili sect, Hasan-e Sabbah seized fortress of Alamut in Daylam.
Assassins murder Persian minister Nizam al-Mulk.
Hasan-e Sabbah split with Fatimid dynasty; Assassins flourished for next several centuries.
First Church of Rome Crusade.
Albigensian Cathari sect flourishes near Albi, France.
Approximate date Sufi Gilani founds Arabic school of Illuminati, Kadiri Order of Sebil-el-ward, in Baghdad.
Assassins infiltrate Thug cult of India.
Avengers and Beati Paoli active in Italy.
Bogomil leader Basil burned in Constantinople.
Joachim of Floris founds primitive Christian sect, Illuminated Ones.
Robin Hood active in England.
Knights Templar founded in Palestine.
Abode of Learning suppressed by Turkish Vizier Afdal.
Rapid growth of Cathari sect begins.
First Cathari bishop established.

Knights Templar issued promissory notes to pilgrims, pilgrims deposited their valuables with a local Templar preceptory (first Banks) before embarking, received a document indicating the value of their deposit, then used that document upon arrival in the Holy Land to retrieve their funds in an amount of treasure of equal value.
Approximate beginnings of the wandering of the Gypsies of North India.
Life of Genghis Khan, conqueror of China and Russia, invader of Europe and Islamic Empire, destroyer of Assassin power.
Cathari council near Toulouse.
Assassination of Thomas a Becket.
Last Fatimid caliph dies.
Peter Waldo founds the Poor Men of Lyons.
Sultan Saladin invades Assassin territory, gains truce.
Waldenses excommunicated, suppressed.
House of Wisdom in Cairo, roots of the Afghan Roshaniya.
Origin of the Mafia in Sicily.
Albigensian Crusade begins suppression of Cathari heresy.
Genghis Khan invades China.
The Children's Crusade.
Founding of the Inquisition to suppress Cathari and other heresies.
Life of Dr. Illuminatus, Ramon Llull (Raymond Lully) in Spain.
Mongols invade Europe through wise use of intelligence information and strategy, introduce gunpowder from Asia.
Massacre of Cathari at Montsegur, France.
Approximate beginning of Holy Vehm in Westphalia.
Approximate time of Hulagu Khan's defeat of the Assassins.
Life of Marco Polo, early European traveller in China, Persia.
Hulagu Khan destroys Baghdad; Mongols destroy Mesopotamia, the mother of civilization.
Mongol invasion of Islamic Empire turned back.
Cathari hierarchy fades.
Assembly of travelling mason guilds in Frankfort.
Zohar, second book of the cabala, compiled by Moses de Leon in Spain.
Roger Bacon, deviser of early eyeglasses, independently invents gunpowder.
Hospitallers retreat to Cyprus.
Inquisition begins suppression of witches and other pagan groups.
White Lotus Society founded in China.
Philip IV of France suppresses Knights Templar for witchcraft and heresies; Jacques de Molay imprisoned in the Temple in Paris.
Assassination of Holy Roman Emperor Albert I.
Hospitallers acquire the isle of Rhodes.
Knights Templar dissolved by papal decree.
De Molay and others burned in Paris.
Assassination of King Edward II in England.
First appearance of the Tarot (book of Thoth) in Germany.
Approximate date of the earliest known Satanic cults; black masses celebrated in France.
Timurlane becomes Great Khan.
Another assembly of travelling mason guilds in Frankfort.
Alleged life of Christian Rosenkreuz, fictitious founder of Rosicrucianism.
Gypsies begin to appear in Europe.
Cathari sect dies out.
Concave lenses developed.
King Robert revises code of Holy Vehm.
Secret society formed in Italy which eventually joins with Rosicrucianism.
Assassination of King James I of Scotland.
Gutenberg Bible begins modern printing.
Abramelin's Book of Sacred Magic translated from Hebrew to French according to followers of the cult of the Guardian Angel.
Assassination of King Henry VI of England.
Fernando Poo discovers 'Fernando Poo island'.
University of Ingolstadt founded.
Assassination of King Edward V of England
Columbus sails the ocean blue.
Rodrigo Borgia, head of the powerful Borgia family, becomes Pope Alexander VI.
Life of Paracelsus, possible founder of Rosicrucianism; discover of zinc around 1530; model of the Faust legend.
Approximate date of Roshaiya, Illuminated Ones, in Afghanistan.
Beginning of Alumbrados in Spain and Charcoal- Burners in Scotland.
Cesare Borgia has his brother-in-law assassinated.
Cesare Borgia arrests and executes enemies who have conspired against him.
Life of Nostradamus, visionary prophet.
Fra Dolcino's version of Joachim's Illuminism suppressed by the Bishop of Vercueil.
Beginning of systematic importation of African slaves into the West Indies.
Machiavelli's The Prince published.
Spanish conquest of Mexico, enslavement of Amerindians.
Hospitallers lose Rhodes to the Turks.
Hospitallers given Isle of Malta by Charles V, become Knights of Malta.
Assassination of Alessandro de Medici, Duke of Florence.
First Inquisition edict against the Alumbrados.
Second edict against Alumbrados.
Approximate date of founding of British Intelligence services.
Life of Jakob Bohme, visionary mystic, illuminated one.
Assassination of William I of Orange in England.
English colony established at Roanoke Island, Virginia; no trace of the 'lost colony' was found when supply ships returned three years later.
Assassination of King Henry III of France.
Janssen makes first compound microscope in Europe.
Anonymous alchemist seeks to start Rosicrucian-like society in Europe.
Rosicrucian constitution published.
First permanent English settlement in America, Jamestown, Virginia.
Italian secrect society headed by Count Bernard of Germany merges with Rosicrucianism.
Apprentice to Dutch spectacle-maker Lippershey discovers principle of focusing lenses; Lippershey builds first telescope.
Galileo independently builds telescope, begins study of astronomy.
Spanish settlement at Santa Fe, New Mexico, founded.
Assassination of King Henry IV of France.
Fama Fraternitatis published, fictional story of Rosenkreuz by Johann Valentin Andrea.
First slave ship in America, Jamestown, Virginia.
Plymouth Colony, second English settlement, arrives on Mayflower.
Posters appear in Paris warning that the Rosicrucian's are 'amongst you...visibly and invisibly.'
Final papal edict against Alumbrados; Guerinets appear in France.
First submarine built by Cornelius van Drebbel in England.
Milton meets Galileo.
Beginning of subliminal persuasion when Rembrandt embeds the word 'sex' in a painting.
Civil War in England between King Charles and Parliament.
Earliest known Masonic Lodge to allow non-professional or 'free' masons, in Warrington, England.
Alleged correspondence between Cromwell and Ebeneezer Pratt plotting the overthrow of King Charles.
Second English Civil War; Oliver Cromwell's New Model Army defeats the Royalist Scottish army of the Duke of Hamilton at the Battle of Preston.
King Charles convicted and beheaded by Parliament.
Illuminated Guerinets come to public notice in France.
Milton's Paradise Lost published.
Leeuwenhoek discovers 'animalcules' through the microscope.
Sperm discovered by Leeuwenhoek's student Ham.
Madame Le Voisin, innovator of modern Satanism, executed in Paris.
Tamanend, sachem and chief of the Lenni-Lenape tribe, welcomes William Penn to America, traditionally considered the beginning of the Tammany Society.
William III of Orange becomes king of England, allegedly through the plotting of the Illuminati.
Bank of England founded.
Quietism of Fenelon and others.
Earliest record of 'operative' or professional Masonic Lodge in Alnwick, England.
The first regular English-language national newspaper, 'The Daily Courant', is published for the first time in Fleet Street, in the City of London; it covers only foreign news.
Founding of modern Freemasonry with the Grand Lodge of London by Desaguliers.
Paris, France, Voltaire imprisoned in the Bastille.
British King George I cracks down on the flourishing Hell Fire Clubs, popular Satanistic cults.
Anderson's Constitutions of the Freemasons published.
Ebrietatis Enconium and other early anti-Masonic works published.
Publication of the anti-Masonic Grand Mysteries of the Freemasons Discovered.
Benjamin Franklin initiated into Freemasonry.
Franklin elected Grand Master of Pennsylvania.
Death of the last leader of the Afghan Illuminated Ones.
Rousseau's spontaneous 'enlightenment' launches the Romantic Movement.
Fictional alchemist Joseph Curwen writes letter stating 'I laste Nighte strucke on ye Wordes that bringe up Yooge-Sothothe,' perhaps the real power behind the Illuminati.
Hell Fire Clubs continue to flourish in Dublin and London.
Six year old Adam Weishaupt is orphaned and goes to live with the Jesuits.
First year of Swedenborg's 'New Era.'
Voltaire's Candide published.
Franklin invents bifocals.
St. Germain founds chemical dye factory in Holland, fore-runner of I.G. Farben; disappears with 100,000 guilders.
Chinese Emperor issues edict against secret societies.
St. Germain discovered living in Russia.
Illumines of France founded.
Sandwich invented.
Swedenborg's Doctrine of Life for the New Jerusalem published.
Voltaire's Philosophical Dictionary published; he begins a prodigious attack on dogmas of church and state.
British Stamp Act imposed to help pay for the French and Indian War debt; Sons of Liberty clubs formed to resist the tax.
Kunta Kinte kidnapped into American slavery.
Townshend Revenue Act, another British tax on the colonies.
Macfarguhar, Ball and Smelie begin compiling the Encyclopedia Britannica.
Mesmer commissions 12 year old Mozart's first opera, Bastien and Bastienne.
Virginia's legislature dissolved for its opposition to the Townshend Act.
Weishaupt graduates from the University of Ingolstadt, becomes tutor and catechist.
Boston Massacre: British troops fire into a crowd.
Townshend Act repealed.
Encyclopedia Britannica published.
Weishaupt becomes professor at University of Ingolstadt.
Alleged meeting of Meyer Rothschild and others to plan a world revolution.
British Tea Tax on colonies; Boston Tea Party in protest.
Franklin's Rule by Which a Great Empire May Be Reduced to a Small One published.
Suppression of the Jesuits.
Weishaupt marries.
Britain's 'Intolerable Acts' designed to punish rebellious colonies.
Casanova becomes secret agent for the Inquisitors of Venice.
Catherine II shuts down satiric journals in Russia.
First Continental Congress.
Jefferson's Summary View of the Rights of British Americans published.
Louis XVI becomes king of France.
Washington begins training troops.
Bushnell's first experimental submarine and torpedo tested.
George III proclaims America in open rebellion.
Initial battles of the Revolutionary War: Lexington, Bunker Hill, Toconderoga.
Prince Hall lodges (for blacks) chartered by Grand Lodge of London, rejected by American lodges.
Second Continental Congress authorizes naval warships, sets up secret committee to procure weapons, names Washington commander-in-chief of the new American Army.
Aaron Burr serves as assistant to Benedict Arnold.
Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations published.
American Declaration of Independence, written by Jefferson, adopted by Continental Congress.
Battles of Long Island, White Plains and Trenton.
Cagliostro initiated into Masonry.
Franklin becomes ambassador to France, is affiliated with French Masonic lodges.
Illuminati founded by Weishaupt.
Nathan Hale executed as spy by British.
Opening of Freemasons' Hall, permanent headquarters of English Masonry.
Saigon captured by Tay Son brothers.
Thomas Paine's Common Sense and The Crisis widely read.
Articles of Confederation adopted by Continental Congress.
Battles of Bennington, Brandywine, Germantown, Princeton and Saratoga.
War of Bavarian Secession begins.
Washington has his mystical vision of the future of the United States while at Valley Forge.
Weishaupt joins Munich Lodge of the Order of Good Council.
France recognizes American independence, signs treaty and provides aid.
Franklin assists in initiation of Voltaire into Masonic Lodge of Paris.
Masonic Convention in Lyons organizes Knights of Beneficence.
Benedict Arnold becomes a traitor and spy for the British.
John Paul Jones says 'I have not yet begun to fight.'
War of Bavarian Secession ends.
First use of the title Odd Fellows.
Illuminati begins rapid growth.
John Andre, British agent, captured with secret documents from Arnold; Arnold escapes to join British; Andre hanged as spy.
Order of the Brotherhood of Asia, Rosicrucian off-shoot, founded.
Weishaupt's wife dies.
John Hanson becomes first President of the United States in Congress Assembled.
Kant's Critique of Pure Reason published.
United Masonic Lodges of Hamburg headed by Fraximus, a secret Rosicrucian.
Weishaupt seeks abortion for his sister-in-law while awaiting dispensation to marry her.
Battle of Guilford Court House, surrender of Cornwallis at Yorktown.
British cabinet agrees to recognize American independence, preliminary agreement signed in Paris.
Casanova retires as secret agent.
Hanson commissions the 'Eye in the Pyramid' Great Seal, finishes term; Elias Boudinot elected second President of Congress Assembled.
Illuminati dominate European Masonry.
Eclectic Rite founded by Baron Knigge in Frankfort.
Ex-Illuminati Utschneider sends letter denouncing the Order to monarch of Bavaria.
Hanson dies.
Rite of Swedenborg founded by Marquis de Throne.
Thomas Mifflin third President of Congress Assembled.
Treaty signed between America and England.
Washington disbands army, resigns.
Webster's American Spelling Book published.
Bavarian Monarch Carl Theodore outlaws secret societies.
Cagliostro moves to Lyons from Bordeaux to found the Mother Lodge of Egyptian Masonry.
Richard Henry Lee fourth President of Congress Assembled.
Royal Commission in Paris, including Franklin and Guillotine as members, investigates Mesmerism and returns a negative report.
Treaty with England ratified by Congress.
Anonymous pamphlet appears in Germany revealing secrets of ancient Egyptian ceremonies.
Franklin returns to America; Jefferson becomes French ambassador.
French 'Diamond Necklace' affair.
Napoleon graduates military school.
Rosicrucian Order suppressed in Austria.
Weishaupt flees to Gotha; new edict outlaws Illuminati; High-ranking Illuminatus Lanz killed by lightning and Illuminati papers found on body by police.
Italian Illuminatus Buonarroti's library of Masonic and subversive books confiscated by state authorities.
Napoleon writes pamphlet defending Rousseau.
Nathaniel Gorham fifth President of Congress Assembled.
Secret congress in Frankfort where Louis XVI and Gustavus III of Sweden condemned to die by Illuminati.
Wisdom Lodge founded in Virginia.
Arthur St. Clair sixth President of Congress Assembled.

German authorities publish letter by Weishaupt admitting he sought abortion for his sister-in-law; Weishaupt replies, blaming 'extenuating circumstances.' German Union (extension of outlawed Bavarian Illuminati) founded by Bahrdt.
Goethe visits Cagliostro's family in Palermo.
Jefferson meets secretly in Paris with Brazilian rebel to discuss American aid to revolution in Brazil.
Shay's Rebellion in Massachusetts to protest unfair taxes.
Society for the Abolition of the African Slave-Trade founded in London.
Swedenborgian Church founded in London.
Washington elected President of Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia; new constitution adopted by the convention.
American Constitution ratified by the states.
Cyrus Griffen seventh President of Congress Assembled.
Individual American states begin to outlaw slavery.
Paine visits London and Paris.
The Federalist essays published by Hamilton, Madison and Jay.
Bavarian edict against Reading Societies.
Blake's Marriage of Heaven and Hell published.
Cagliostro arrested by Inquisition of Rome.
French Revolution begins.
Jefferson returns to U.S. to become first Secretary of State; Hamilton becomes first Secretary of the Treasury.
Washington elected President of the United States; first Congress under new Constitution.
Rebellion and massacre throughout France.
Burr begins converting Tammany Society into a political machine.
First Bank of the United States chartered.
Mozart's The Magic Flute, containing Masonic elements, performed.
Napoleon joins the Jocobin Club.

The anonymous Vie de Joseph Balsamo (Joseph Basalmo was Cagliostro's name before he joined the Masons), first recorded link of the Illuminati and the French Revolution, appears in several European countries.
Assassination of Gustav III at the Stockholm opera.
Catherine II outlaws Masonry in Russia.
Elections for the National Convention, a triumph for Robespierre and his followers.
First Swedenborgian church in America.
France declared a Republic.
Life of Joseph Balsamo translated into English in Dublin.
Louis XVI imprisoned in the Templars Temple tower.
Massacres of September, in which priests, bishops and others are killed.
War between France and Austria.
Washington re-elected.
France declares war on England and the Dutch United Provinces.
French food riots.
French government kills thousands of its citizens.
Russia and Prussia begin partition of Poland.
war breaks out with Spain and Austria.
Year One of the French Republic; the year of the Terror, Louis XVI found guilty of conspiracy, condemned to be executed.
attempts of Robespierre's life; his enemies accuse him of attempting to have himself declared divine by Catherine Theot, an old woman who preached a mystery religion; Robespierre guillotined.
Monroe becomes minister to France.
Whiskey rebellion in Pennsylvania to protest liquor taxes.
Would-be assassin of Robespierre fires on Collot d'Herbois instead; the next day a young girl arrested as suspected assassin; she and 40 others sent to guillotine.
Year Two; France passes laws distributing confiscated property to the poor, leads victorious battle against Austrians.
France makes peace with Prussia and Spain, invades Holland.
Napoleon suppresses revolt in Paris and goes to Italy as Commander-in-Chief.
Yazoo land fraud: bribed Georgia legislators sell Mississippi.
Adams elected President.
Paine publishes letter critical of Washington.
Illuminati scare in New England.
Knights of Malta lose their island to Napoleon.
Death of Thomas Waley, one of the last Hell Fire Club leaders.
Napoleon comes to power, allegedly through Illuminati manipulation.
Life of Auguste Blanqui, French socialist, founder of numerous secret societies modelled after Buonarroti.
Napoleon's Waterloo.
Secret societies which eventually become the Decembrist Movement formed in Russian Masonic lodges.
Irish immigrants force entry into Tammany Society, changing its direction.
Suppression of the Lodge of Jupiter the Thunderer begins.
Mary Shelley's Frankenstein published.
American Independent Order of Odd Fellows founded.
Founding of National Freemasonry, the most important of several Polish secret societies devoted to ousting the Russians from Poland.
Liberation of Columbia by Bolivar.
Ecuador liberated by Bolivar.
Russian government suppresses Masonry.
Bolivar liberates Bolivia.
Decembrist movement suppressed in Russia after brief uprising.
Founding of Vienna bank by Solmon Rothschild and Naples bank by Carl Rothschild.
Anti-Masonic Party founded, first third-party in America.
Attempted assassination of Bolivar.
Tammany Society backs Andrew Jackson for President.
Alleged Illuminati meeting in New York decides to unite Atheists and Nihilists into Communist movement.
Anti-Masonic conventions in Massachusetts and Vermont find evidence linking Masonry with Illuminism.
Book of Mormon published.
Weishaupt and Bolivar die.
Anti-Masonic Party runs Wirt for President, assuring that Mason Andrew Jackson would be re-elected.
Poe dismissed from West Point.
Jackson orders U.S. funds withdrawn from Bank of the United States, effectively killing the institution.
Attempted assassination of Jackson with two single shot pistols, both of which jammed.
Revolver invented.
The socialist League of the Just founded in Paris, later becoming the Marxist Communist League.
Bahai religion begins when the Bab proclaims his mission in Persia.
Morse builds first practical telegraph.
Abdication of Ferdinand I in Austria.
Fall of monarchy in France.

Fortean tidbits; moon turns 'blood-red' during total eclipse; a great comet fails to return at the time predicted; visions and 'phantom soldiers' seen in the skies of France and Scotland; Captain M'Quahae of H.M.S. Daedalus reports seeing a 'huge, unknown creature' in the ocean.
Germany briefly united in a parliament at Frankfort; unity destroyed by the King of Prussia.
Gold discovered in California.
Marx and Engles publish the Communist Manifesto (allegedly commissioned by the Illuminati) and travel in France and Germany encouraging discontent with the Establishment.
Republic established in Rome.
Revolts in Denmark, Ireland, Lombardy, Schleswig-Holstein and Venice.
Spiritualism born in Wayne County, New York, when the teenaged Fox sisters communicate with poltergeists.
Woman's Suffrage Movement gets underway in Seneca Falls, New York.
Life of Sir Basil Zaharoff, 'mystery man of Europe,' who made a fortune as an armaments dealer and financier, selling weapons to both sides in World War I and other conflicts.
Benjamin becomes first professed Jew elected to Congress.
Darwin's Origin of Species published.
Oil wells invented.
Attempts to suppress the Mafia in Sicily are unsuccessful.
Electric storage battery invented.
Lincoln elected.
American Civil War begins.
Confederate states secede; elect Jefferson Davis president; Benjamin appointed Confederate Attorney General, later Secretary of War.
Emancipation of serfs in Russia.
Gatling gun patented.
Jacolliot writes about the Nine Unknown in Calcutta.
Benjamin appointed Confederate Secretary of State.
Rockefeller builds his first refinery.
David Farragut says 'Damn the torpedoes! Four bells! Captain Drayton, go ahead! Jouett, full speed!'
American Civil War ends.
Assassination of Lincoln; Andrew Johnson becomes president; 'Booth' killed; coded message found among his effects; the code key later found in possession of Benjamin, alleged Rothschild agent.
Thirteenth amendment abolishes slavery.
Benjamin flees to England.
Death of Phineas Quimby, magnetic healer, founder of Free Thought movement, teacher of Mary Baker Eddy.
Ku Klux Klan founded as a social club in Pulaski, Tennessee.
Ku Klux Klan reorganized along political and racial lines near Nashville, Tennessee.
Assassination of Thomas D'Arcy McGee, first Canadian political assassination.
Mendeleev composes first periodic table of the elements in Russia.
St. Germain allegedly completes 85 years in the Himalayas after his 'death.'
U.S. transcontinental railroad completed.
Standard Oil Company incorporated.
'Whiskey Ring' conspiracy of distillery owners revealed.
Life of Aleister Crowley, the Great Beast, Golden Dawn leader and occult figure.
Madam Blavatsky founds Theosophy Society.
Mary Baker Eddy's Science and Health published.
Battle of the Little Big Horn.
Bell patents telephone.
Disraeli again warns about dangers of secret societies.
Otto builds four-cycle gasoline engine.
First of seven wills in which Cecil Rhodes leaves his money to establish a secret society to expand British rule throughout the world.
Life of Edgar Cayce, visionary, trance-channeler who spoke of reincarnation, Egyptian mysteries, and Atlantis.
Czar Alexander II assassinated by secret society.
Disraeli publishes Lothair, a novel about secret societies and European politics.
Garfield assassinated.
Fabian Society founded in London by Sidney and Beatrice Webb and others.
First practical horseless carriage built by Daimler.
Golden Dawn founded in London by Mathers and others.
Michaelson-Morley experiment disproving ether theory.

Unsolved murders of London prostitutes by 'Jack the Ripper,' suspected of being one of those implicated in the Cleveland Street Affair involving high-society Victorians and their patronage of a brothel staffed by messenger boys.
Second Communist International organized.
Biologist Yersin visits India, purportedly to receive plague and cholera serum from the Nine Unknown.
Wounded Knee massacre.
Nikola Tesla invents Tesla coil, becomes U.S. citizen.
Rhodes gains control of 90% of world's diamond supply.
Rockefeller grant founds University of Chicago.
The Round Tables, a secret society allegedly funded by Rhodes and the Rothschild's to gain financial and political power, founded in the U.S., Canada, Australia, India, South Africa and New Zealand.
Rockefeller trust transferred to holding company: Standard Oil of New Jersey.
Assassination of Chicago Mayor Harrison.
Assassination of President Carnot of France.
First 'flap year' for UFOs; wave of sightings of unidentified airships in U.S.
Marconi's patent No. 7777 for radio.
Assassination of Premier Canovas of Spain.
Zionism founded in Basil, Switzerland by Theodore Herzl.
Assassination of Empress Elizabeth of Austria.
Pavlov begins study of conditioned reflex in dogs.
Alleged meeting in England at which the Morgan's, Rothschild's and Warburg's become affiliated.
Tesla discovers terrestrial stationary waves which can produce electricity; reports receiving signals from another planet.
Approximate date Adolf Lanz founded the Order of New Templars, a fore-runner of the Nazi mentality.
Assassination of King Umberto I of Italy and Kentucky Governor-elect William Goebel.
Boxer rebellion in China.
Tesla suggests alien beings might be living 'in the very midst of us.'
Assassination of McKinley and Russian Education Minister Bogolepov.
First trans-Atlantic radio broadcast: Marconi sends the letter S.
Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research (Rockefeller University) founded in New York.
Assassination of Russian Minister of Interior Sipyagain.
Paul and Felix Warburg immigrate from Germany to the U.S. Rockefeller General Education Board founded.
Assassination of Bogdanovich, Governor of Ufa.
Protocols of Elders of Zion, alleged plan for Jewish world takeover, published in Russian newspaper.
Assassination of Russian Premier Vischelev von Plehev.
Abortive revolution in Russia.
Assassination of Grand Duke Sergius and Idaho Governor Steunenberg.
Expanded version of Protocols of Zion published.
Assassination of Russian General Dubrassov.
Financial panic and depression allegedly caused by J.P. Morgan to gain support for the central bank concept.
Assassination of King Carl of Prussia and Crown Prince of Portugal.
FBI founded.
Founding of the Armanen Initiates, another pro-Nazi secret society.
Attempted assassination of Mayor Gaynor of NYC.
Secret meeting of bankers and politicians at Jekyll Island, Georgia, results in Federal Reserve Act.
Assassination of Prime Minister Staliapin of Russia by police double agent.
Standard Oil of New Jersey broken up as illegal monopoly.
The Hoher Armanen Orden (High Armanen Order) was the inner college of the Guido von List Society; its design was a magical order to proliferate Listâ€™s deeper runic-based initiations.
Attempted assassination of Teddy Roosevelt.
Colonel E.M. House, adviser to Woodrow Wilson, publishes Philip Dru: Administrator, a political romance which proposed modern social legislation.
Founding of Germanen Order, another pre-Nazi secret society.
Assassination of prime minister, JosÃ© Canalejas y MÃ©ndez, of Spain.
Assassination of George I of Greece.
Rockefeller Foundation founded.
Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife were assassinated in Sarajevo by the 19-year-old Gavrilo Princip, a member of 'Young Bosnia'.
Attempted assassination of Archduke Ferdinand of Austria by Masonic agents, followed an hour later by successful assassination; in Russia, Rasputin stabbed the same day.
The first attempt on Rasputin's life, when he was stabbed in the abdomen by Chionya Gusyeva in his home village of Pokrovskoye in Siberia, Russia: He survived the attempt.
World War I begins.
Alfred Wegener proposed theory of continental drift, receives ridicule and contempt from his fellow scientists.
Ku Klux Klan revived.
Sinking of the Lusitania by German submarine; allegedly carrying secret munitions for the Allies, the ship supposedly sacrificed by British and American authorities to drum up war hysteria in U.S.
Assassination of Rasputin.
Russian Revolution begins; Cheka, secret police of Bolsheviks, founded.
United States enters World War I.
Assassination of Russian Czar Nicholas II and his family.
Attempted assassination of Lenin.
New Thought lecturer David Van Bush hires H.P. Lovecraft as a ghost writer.
Charles Fort's The Book of the Damned published.
Founding of Thule Society in Germany; Hitler recruited.
Freud draws attention to Austrian neurologist Poetzl's experiments with the tachistroscope, an early device for studying subliminal perception.
Hitler joins the German Workers' Party.
League of Nations founded at Paris Peace Conference.

Meeting at the Majestic Hotel, Paris, between Wilsonian intellectuals (House, Dulles and Dulles, etc.) and 'like-minded Englishmen' to discuss forming an organization 'for the study of international affairs.'
Royal Institute of International Affairs founded.
Assassination of estimated 400 German public figures begins.
Development of modern advertising techniques emphasizing manipulation rather than information.
GWP becomes the National Socialist German Worker's Party.
U.S. entry into League of Nations blocked in Senate.
Council on Foreign Relations incorporated; founded by Wilsonians House, Dulles and company upon their return from Paris, with the help of the Round Table Group.
Hitler takes over the NSGWP.
Marconi states he believes mysterious V code on pre-WWI radio came from space; Tesla recalls seeing lights, vivid images, when he was a boy.
CFR journal Foreign Affairs founded.
Cheka reorganized as GPU, Russian secret police.
King Tutankhamen's tomb opened in Egypt, thus invoking 'King Tut's Curse'; 14 violent deaths in as many years linked to the curse.
Mussolini, alleged British Intelligence agent, comes to power in Italy, begins attempt to eliminate Mafia in Sicily.
Assassination of Pancho Villa in Mexico.
Fort's New Lands published.
Founding of Hitler's National-Socialist (Nazi) Party in Germany.

In the face of the Teapot Dome and other scandals, President Harding visits Alaska and receives a 'long ciphered message' which visibly upsets him, causing him to ask what a president could do when friends betrayed him; he died soon after among conflicting rumours about the cause of his death.
International Police (Interpol) founded in Vienna.

During Mars' closest approach radios around the world went off the air in order to allow interception of any possible messages from space; when translated onto photographic tape, signals received produced crudely drawn faces.
J. Edgar Hoover takes over FBI.
Lovecraft ghostwrites for Houdini.
Lionel Curtis organizes the Institutes of Pacific Relations in at least ten countries for the Round Table Group.
Suicide of synchronicity researcher Paul Krammerer, biologist, Freemason.
Rise of the CFR due to Rockefeller and other foundation funding.
The Crystal Skull discovered in ruins of Lubaantun in British Honduras.
Nomination of Catholic Al Smith sparks last spurt of growth for the KKK.
Soviet produced film shows conditioned reflex experiments on humans.
CFR moves to Harold Pratt Building on 68th Street.
Great Depression begins.
Quisling's About the Matter That Inhabited Worlds Outside Ours and the Significance Caused by It to Our Philosophy of Life published.
Continuing political assassinations accompany Nazi rise to power.
Mafia becomes integral part of the U.S. organized crime.
Pavlov begins applying knowledge of conditioned reflex to human psychosis.
Fort's Lo! published.
Fort dies after publishing his last book, Wild Talents.
Attempted assassination of Franklin Roosevelt; Chicago mayor Cermak killed instead.
FDR orders use of Great Seal of the U.S. on reverse side of the dollar bill.
Reich-stag Fire, set by Nazis, used to suspend civil liberties.
Assassination of S.M. Kirov, Soviet leader and Stalin collaborator.
Beginning of Hitler's Black Order.
Russian GPU renamed NKVD.
Unexplained 'ghostflier' broadcasts in Sweden.
Assassination of Senator Huey Long.
First lobotomy performed by Egas Moniz in Lisbon.
Beginning of Moscow Purge trials in which numerous communist leaders were brainwashed into false confessions and then executed.
Amelia Earhart Putnam, aviator, disappears.
First of 48 'Lost Colony' stones found in North Carolina; stones supposedly tell the story of lost Roanoke Island colony.
Spanish Civil War begins.
Assassination of Leon Sedov, Trotsky's son; first assassination attempt against Trotsky.
Electroshock treatment discovered.
Nazi invasion of Austria; Interpol exiled - or taken over by Nazis; German expedition to Antarctica stakes out 600,000 square kilometres, lands near the South Pole.
Orson Welles' dramatization of H.G. Wells' War of the Worlds scares American radio listeners.
Amateur radio astronomer Grote Reber receives dot-dash signal from space.
Attempted assassination of Hitler.
Attorney Leon Cooke, friend of Jack Ruby and financial secretary of the union which employed Ruby, killed by union president Jack Martin; union subsequently taken over by Mafia.
CFR offers it services to U.S. State Dept.
Germany invades Poland; World War II begins.
Interpol grouped with Gestapo.
League of Nations suspended.
Assassination of Leon Trotsky in Mexico.
British secret police renamed MI-5 and MI-6 for duration of war.
Interpol moved to near Berlin., with Reinhard Heydrich in charge.
Nazis allegedly begin building Hitler's secret hideout in Antarctica.
Roosevelt sends Gen. 'Wild Bill' Donovan on info-gathering mission to Europe; Donovan recommends a central intelligence organization.
U.S. State Dept. creates 'Division of Special Research' headed by CFR member Pasbolsky.
Donovan made head of new Office of Coordinator of Information.
Japan attacks U.S. Fleet at Pearl Harbor, allegedly through the manoeuvring of Roosevelt and his advisors to provide an excuse to enter the war.
The Books of Charles Fort published.
Assassination of Interpol chief Heydrich in Czechoslovakia.
Donovan's OCI evolves into the Office of Strategic Services (OSS).
Juan Peron and other pro-Nazi leaders take power in Argentina.
LSD-25 discovered by Swiss chemist Albert Hofmann.
Nazi Admiral Doenitz boasts the German submarine fleet has built 'in another part of the world a Shangri-La on land, an impregnable fortress.'
Pilots on both sides of the war report seeing 'foo-fighters,' unexplained flying objects, while flying war missions.
American band leader Glenn Miller disappears on unarmed flight over the English Channel.
Attempted assassination of Hitler.
Donovan prepares plan for Roosevelt to establish a central intelligence agency which is pigeon-holed, later reconsidered by Truman.
Nazis begin sending millions of dollars worth of jewels, paintings and cash to Argentina for safe keeping.
Russian NKVD reorganized as MGB.

'Official beginning of Bermuda Triangle mystery,' when Flight 19, made up of five naval bombers, disappears off the coast of Florida; another plane sent to investigate also disappears - 6 planes and 27 men vanished.
Alleged assassination (suicide) of James Forrestal at Bethesda Hospital Neurological Ward, after his attempt to warn Roosevelt of Illuminati plot.
An Air Force plane's engines fail over Iwo Jima as foo-fighters maneuver around it.
CFR allegedly takes over State Dept.
First atomic bombs dropped.

General Gehlen, Head of Nazi Intelligence, captured by U.S. Army and flown to Washington; other Nazi and British agents imported to U.S., along with Werner Von Braun and other developers of the V-2 rockets.

Hitler allegedly escapes from Berlin after arranging for a fake suicide cover story; Hitler's death announced, Admiral Doenitz takes command; submarines U-530, U-977 and others begin secret journey from Norway soon after Quisling allegedly refused Hitler's offer to take him 'aboard a submarine to a safe refuge'; two months after Germany surrenders submarines U-530 and U-977 give themselves up in Mar del Plata, Argentina, after allegedly being lost from the submarine convoy taking Hitler and others to their hideout in Antarctica; Nazi leader Martin Bormann escapes without a trace from Berlin after supervising Hitler's 'suicide.'
Interpol dissolved - or reorganized with headquarters in Paris, the story varies.
Mussolini killed.
OSS disbanded, its agents moving to military intelligence agencies and the State Dept.
Roosevelt dies, Truman becomes president.
United Nations founded.
World War II ends.
Admiral Byrd allegedly leads Naval 'research' expedition to Antarctica to attack Hitler's secret hideout; attempt allegedly fails and Hitler and his 'UFO scientists' continue their activities.
Gehlen returns to Germany to continue intelligence work for U.S. Army.
Interpol reorganization meeting held in Brussels.
John Kennedy and Richard Nixon elected to House of Representatives.
Murder of wire service king James Ragen by Syndicate friends of Jack Ruby; indictment dropped following additional murders.
Truman's executive order sets up the National Intelligence Authority and Central Intelligence Group.
Waves of unexplained 'ghost rockets' seen in Europe, especially Scandinavia.
Attempted assassination of Minneapolis Mayor Hubert Humphrey.

France creates the Service de Documentation ExtÃ©rieure et de Contre-Espionnage (External Documentation and Counter-Espionage Service), abbreviated SDECE (French: [zdÉ›k]), was France's external intelligence agency from 6 November 1944 to 2 April 1982, similar to CIA.

Maury Island 'hoax': an early Men-In-Black incident three days before the Arnold sighting, in which a 'donut-shaped object' dropped slag on a boat near Tacoma, Washington; the next day an MIB visited Harold Dahl, who was piloting the boat, and warned him not to discuss the sighting; the boat's owner, Fred Crisman, was suspected of being a CIA employee and was later called to give secret testimony at the trial of Clay Shaw in New Orleans; pilot Dahl disappeared and UFOlogist Arnold, who investigated the case, reported unexplained failure of his own plane's engine soon after two Air Force investigators were killed taking off from Tacoma's airport.
National Security Act establishes Dept. of Defence, National Security Council and Central Intelligence Agency.
Partition of India receives 'strong impetus from the Round Table Group.'
Second UFO flap year; Kenneth Arnold reports flying saucers near Yakima, Washington, and other reports soon follow.
Assassination of Mahatma Gandhi.
Attempted assassination of labour leader Walter Reuther.
Beginning of CIA interest in UFOs as a 'security' problem.
Beginning of Operation Ohio, a CIA program responsible for one hundred European assassinations during the next ten years.
Martin Bormann reported living in Argentina.
McCord employed by the FBI.
New nation of Israel creates Central Institute for Intelligence and Security.

Nixon gains prominence in the Alger Hiss case as member of the House Un-American Activities Committee; goes to Miami where he meets Bebe Rebozo and goes yachting with other underworld-connected figures.
World Council of Churches founded in Amsterdam.
Chaing Kai-shek flees to Formosa; mainland China taken by communist leaders; Social Affairs Dept. and other Chinese secret police created.
E. Howard Hunt becomes CIA agent; Clay Shaw becomes agent for CIA's Domestic Contact Service.
Interpol granted consultive status by UN.
Report critical of CIA filed and forgotten, unread by Truman; Central Intelligence Act exempts CIA from disclosure laws.
The Gehlen Organization transferred to CIA control.
Trial of Cardinal Mindszenty in Hungary following his brainwashing and confession of conspiracy.
U.S. Army begins 20 years of simulated germ warfare attacks against American cities, conducting at least 239 open air tests.
Alleged CIA plot to introduce UFO contact ideas with 'Little Green Men' stories and radio contact 'from space.'
Approximate starting date of building of Mount Weather, secret American government fortress.
Attempted assassination of Truman by Puerto Rican nationalists.
CIA organizes the Pacific Corporation, a large holding company which was the first of many CIA 'private' enterprises.
Congress passes McCarran's Internal Security Act setting up program for detention of subversives.
Hiss convicted of perjury; Nixon elected to Senate after smear campaign against California opponent.
Korean War begins.
Malcolm X receives visit from an MIB while in prison.
National Council of Churches founded in U.S.
U.S. Army engages in 'simulated' germ warfare in San Francisco and the Pentagon.

Worlds in Collision by Immanuel Velikovsky proposes a catastrophic theory of ancient history, in which a huge 'comet' of matter is ripped out of Jupiter, approaches Earth close enough to cause universal fire/flood legends in primitive folklore and then settles into orbit as a new planet, Venus; Velikovsky receives ridicule and contempt from his fellow scientists, thought 20 years later Jupiter is generally considered a 'cold star' rather than a planet and Velikovsky's prediction of a hot climate on Venus is confirmed.
Approximate date CBS begins active cooperation with CIA.
Army simulated germ warfare project in Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania.
Assassination of Ali Razmara of Iran, Riad Al-Sulh and Abdullah of Jordan and Ali Knah Liaquat of Pakistan.
McCord moves from FBI to CIA.
North Korean brainwashing of American prisoners begins.
Time magazine popularizes the term brainwashing.
Army germ warfare project in Key West, Florida, and Ft. McCellan, Alabama.
CIA agent Downey and Fecteau captured while on spy mission in China.
Eisenhower elected president, Nixon vice-president; Kennedy elected to Senate.
First UFO 'contact' case: George Adamski meets Venusians in California desert; alleged CIA plot to start UFO scare.
Third UFO flap year.
UFOlogist George Williamson, one of Adamski's witnesses, claims he also witnessed ham radio operator establish contact with another world.
21 POWs defect.
Army germ warfare project in Panama City, Florida.
CIA contemplates developing drugs to cause amnesia in retired agents.
CIA's Robertson Panel views UFO reports as national security threat.
Dr. Frank Olsen commits suicide after having been given a secret dose of LSD by the CIA, under the direction of the mysterious Dr. Sidney Gottlieb.
Mau Mau (Hidden Ones) formed in Kenya to overthrow white rule.
Return of Korean War prisoners, including some who underwent brainwashing.
UFOlogist Albert Bender closes down his International Flying Saucer Bureau after being visited by three MIB.
Army germ warfare project in Point Mugu and Fort Hueneme, California.
Attempted assassinations of several U.S. Congressmen by Puerto Rican nationalists.
Broadcaster Frank Edwards fired for discussing UFOs on the air.
Condemnation by the U.S. Senate of Joseph McCarthy following his charges of subversion in high places.
First Bilderberger meeting takes place at the Bilderberg Hotel, Oosterbeek, Holland.
Hunt involved in CIA overthrow of communist regime in Guatemala, Carlos Castillo-Armas becomes president.
Richard Bissell joins the CIA.
Russian KGB created to replace earlier secret police.
Strange voice 'from space' speaks from turned-off radios in mid-west U.S. and London, warns against preparations for war.
Assassination of Jose Antonio Remon of Panama and Adnan Al-Malki of Syria.
Bilderberger meeting in Barbizon, France.
Doug Durham joins the Marines.
Lee Harvey Oswald meets David Ferrie of the New Orleans Civil Air Patrol.

The Office of Naval Research allegedly receives a copy of Morris Jessup's The Case for the UFOs with marginal notes in three different hands, supposedly by 'Gypsies' knowledgeable in UFOlogy; ONR reprints several hundred copies for internal use; an MIB called 'Carlos Allende' is implicated in the affair.
Assassination of Anastasio Somoza of Nicaragua.
Bilderberger meeting in Frednsborg, Denmark.
Clay Shaw's CIA contact allegedly stopped.
Durham receives special CIA training.
Oswald joins Marines.
UFOlogist Gray Barker publishes 'They Knew Too Much About Flying Saucers' which reported numerous MIB incidents.
Alleged assassination of Joseph McCarthy at Bethesda Hospital Neurological Ward, after warning of Illuminati plot.
Anti-atomic bomb propaganda disseminated by saucer clubs - another CIA plot?
Assassination of Carlos Castillo-Armas of Guatemala.
Bilderberger meetings in St. Simon Island, Georgia, and Fiuggui, Italy.
CIA helps Iran form SAVAK, secret police later accused of assassination Iranian dissidents.
Exiled Ukrainian politician Lev Rebet assassinated by KGB agent in Munich.
Experiments in behaviour modification sleep-teaching take place at California penal institution Woodland Road Camp.
Fourth UFO flap year.
General Edwin Walker commands federal troops sent to enforce racial integration at Little Rock, Arkansas.
Oswald assigned to base at Atsugi, Japan, where CIA U-2 planes were launched; shoots self in elbow.
Unexplained short wave radio signals received worldwide.
Assassination of Abdul Llah, Faisal II and Nuri Al-Said of Iraq.
Bilderberger meeting in Buxton, England.
Francis Gary Powers released from Air Force and assigned to covert CIA spying.
Ham radio operators pick up a male voice claiming to be Nacoma of Jupiter and warning of atomic bomb disaster in English, German, Norwegian and his own unknown language.
John Birch Society organized by Robert Welch.
Kerry Thornley and Gregory Hill found Discordianism and publish Principia Discordia, or How I Found Goddess and What I Did To Her When I Found Her; Thornley joins Marine Corps.
Nelson Rockefeller elected governor of New York.
Oswald on manoeuvres  in the Philippines involving U-2 flights.
Russia launches first space satellites.
Unidentified ex-Marine lives in Minsk, USSR, apparently gathering information for the CIA.
Apparent suicide of UFO researcher Morris Jessup who had received communications from 'Carlos Allende,' one of the MIB and whose book was mysteriously annotated by UFOlogical Gypsies.
Assassination of Solomon W.R. Bandaranaike of Ceylon.
Attempted assassination of Senator Bircher of Ohio and Governor Almond of Virginia.
Bilderberger meeting in Yesilkov, Turkey.
Condon's The Manchurian Candidate published.
Durham discharged from Marines, stationed at CIA base in Guatemala.
Exiled Ukrainian politician Stephan Bandera assassinated by KGB agent in Munich.
Fidel Castro assumes power in Cuba; Cuban Intelligence (DGI) begun.
Kerry Thornley first meets fellow Marine Oswald in California; Oswald released from Marines, defects to Russia.
Ruby visits casino owner in Havana.
Thornley assigned to U-2 base in Atsugi, Japan.
UFO sighting at CIA headquarters after Naval officer contacts 'space people' while in CIA-observed trance.
Assassination of Hazza Majali of Jordan.
Bernard Baker serves as conduit for Bay of Pigs funding.
Bilderberger meeting in Burgenstock, Switzerland.

CIA buys Southern Air Transport; contemplates development of 'recruitment pills' and other drugs; studies mysterious amnesia of Korean war prisoners moved through Manchuria; contemplates giving truth serum to brainwashed American POWs.
CIA spy Powers shot down in U-2 over Russia; summit conference cancelled.
Eisenhower authorizes training and arming Cuban exiles, allegedly issues orders for the assassination of Congolese leader Patrice Lumumba.
Kennedy-Nixon debates; Kennedy elected president.
Nixon, CIA agent Bissell and others plan Bay of Pigs invasion, obtain permission to use Guatemala as launching point.
Oswald assigned job in Belarusian Radio Factory in Minsk, USSR.
Project Ozma, searching for intelligent signals from another part of the universe, receives unexplained signals from space.
Thornley discharged from Marines.
Assassination of Lumumba of the Congo, Rafael Trujillo Molina of the Dominican Republic and Louis Rivagasore of Nurundi.
Attempted assassination of Castro by Hans Tanner.
Bilderberger meeting in Quebec, Canada.

Brooks introduces Thornley to his 'brother-in-law,' Gary Kirstein, allegedly an undercover E. Howard Hunt; Thornley and 'Kirstein' begin nearly three-year relationship of discussing Nazis, mind-control, the status of philosopher-kings, and plans to assassinate Kennedy.
Ferrie, Gordon Novel and two others arrested in burglary of Louisiana arms bunker.
General Walker resigns after criticism of his anti-communist indoctrination of troops.
George De Mohrenschildt on hiking trip through Guatemala.
Kennedy develops extracurricular relationship with Judith Campbell, Sam Giancana's girlfriend; Giancana and John Roselli enlisted by CIA to attempt Castro assassination.
Michael Rockefeller disappears in New Guinea.
Milgram's Yale experiments demonstrating dangers of obedience to authority.
Robert Morrow, working with Ruby, Shaw and Ferrie, allegedly smuggle weapons from Greece to Central America for the CIA; also picks up information for CIA from 'Harvey' in the Soviet Union.

Thornley arrives to New Orleans; Slim Brooks gives Thornley 'the haircut' on his 23rd birthday; the same day, the CIA invasion of Cuba at the Bay of Pigs, launched from Guatemala, fails due to poor planning and cancellation of support by Kennedy; the CIA, the Mob, Cuban-exiles, right-wingers and Nixonites supposedly vow revenge against Kennedy.
U.S. Military Advisor Group begins defoliation project (agent-Orange) in Vietnam which eventually covers over 12% of land area.
Unexplained transmissions from space monitored by ham radio operators worldwide; Bob Renaud, ham operator, allegedly makes contact with aliens.
Unidentified Marine from Minsk divulges information to CIA agent in Copenhagen.
Bilderberger meeting in Saltsjobaden, Sweden.
CIA allegedly pays a Canadian agriculture technician to infect Cuban turkeys with Newcastle disease (though the technician supposedly double-crossed them).
CIA begins using secret terror teams in Vietnam, roots of Operation Phoenix.
CIA interference in Ecuadorian politics.
Cuban missile crisis.
De Mohrenschildt, friend of the Kennedys, befriends the Oswalds in Dallas.
Dr. Edgar Schein outlines behaviour modification programs for U.S. prisons, based on Korean brainwashing techniques.
Durham employed by Des Moines Police Dept.
Film version of The Manchurian Candidate released.
Hunt becomes head of CIA's new Domestic Operations Division.
Lee Harvey Oswald returns to America with his Russian wife, Marina Nikolayevna Prusakova, an alleged KGB agent.

Retired General Walker arrested on Attorney Robert Kennedy's orders when Walker became involved in the racial disorders in Oxford, Mississippi; Walker stripped naked and flown to Springfield, Missouri, prison for examination; Walker reported to be incompetent but was later released and ran against John Connally for Governor of Texas.
Ruby allegedly flies from Mexico City to visit Havana.
Suicide of Marilyn Monroe under questionable circumstances.
UFOlogist Williamson disappears in South America.
The U.S. Embassy gave Oswald a repatriation loan of $435.71
Alleged assassination attempt of JFK in Miami but right-winger Milteer spills the beans; another attempt in Chicago also supposedly foiled.

Assassination of Sylvanus Olympio of Togo, Abdul Karim Kassem of Iraq, Medgar Evers of US, Ngo Dinh Diem of South Vietnam and John Kennedy of US; Texas Gov. John Connally wounded, police officer Tippit and Oswald killed.
Attempted assassination of Castro in which CIA agent Rorke is killed.
Attempted assassination of General Walker in Dallas earlier, allegedly by Oswald; Oswald also supposedly threatened to kill ex-Veep Nixon, or was it Veep Johnson? the Warren Commission wasn't sure.
Bilderberger meeting in Cannes, France.
CIA begins weather modification project over Hue, Vietnam.
Ecuadorian government overthrown.
Johnson becomes president; almost immediately reverses JFK's decision to withdraw from Vietnam.
Numerous MIB spotted in Dealy Plaza.
Profumo scandal in England, involving sex and spying, brings down Conservative government.
Russia sends first woman into space.
Unexplained radio transmission interrupts astronaut Gordon Cooper in unidentified language.
Assassination of Jigme P. Dorji of Bhutan.
Bilderberger meeting in Williamsburg, Virginia.
Congress passes the Tonkin Gulf resolution giving LBJ power to make war on Vietnam.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Betty Mooney MacDonald, former Carousel Club stripper who had met Oswald at a party and provided an alibi for Darrell Wayne Garner (who was accused of wounding Tippit - killing witness Warren Reynolds), found hanged in her cell after being arrested for fighting with her room-mate.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Bill Hunter, Long Beach Press-Telegram reporter, who had met with Ruby's room-mate George Senator and Ruby's attorney Tom Howard at Ruby's apartment a few hours after Oswald's murder, shot to death by a policeman in Long Beach, California, police station, accidentally.
Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Garner disappears, later found dead.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Gary Underhill, former Life editor and CIA agent who begged friends to protect him because he knew who killed Kennedy, found shot in left side of head - ruled suicide even though he was right-handed.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Hank Killam, whose wife Wanda was also a stripper at Ruby's club and who was a friend of John Carter who once lived in Oswald's rooming house, evades police for several months, then found with a slashed throat in Pensacola, Florida.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Jim Koethe, Dallas Times-Herald reporter also present at the meeting in Ruby's apartment, killed by karate chop to the throat as he emerged from the shower.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Mary Meyer, painter, niece of forester Gifford Pinchot and one of JFK's lovers (who allegedly funnelled LSD from an unsuspecting Timothy Leary to JFK), shot while taking a walk in Washington, D.C. - her secret diary confiscated by her CIA friend James Angleton, later allegedly destroyed.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Puerto Rican Teamster Ramon Ducos and Miguel Cruz who was allegedly arrested with Oswald in New Orleans and who claimed to have killed Kennedy; Chavez later killed by his bodyguard, Miguel Cruz.
Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Robert Kennedy allegedly stalked in assassination plot during his New York senatorial race by Frank Chavez, associate of Ruby.
Durham kills wife, terminated from Des Moines police.
Report of the Warren Commission on the Assassination of President Kennedy released; Commission finds that Oswald, acting alone, killed JFK.
Virginia Miller, later known as 'Blue Dove,' allegedly begins career as 'disrupter' in the Amerindian community; later serves as FBI informer on Indian activities.
Another ham radio operator, Sidney Padrick, makes contact with UFO aliens.
Assassination of Pierre Ngendandumwe of Burundi, Hassan Ali Mansour of Iran, Malcolm X of US and Mario Mendez Montenegro of Guatemala.
Bilderberger meeting in Lake Como, Italy.
California highway inspector Rex Heflin, who took pictures of UFOs, visited by MIB who took the original photographs and left; NORAD denies they were their men, as claimed.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Dorothy Kilgallen, columnist and TV panel-show figure who had a private half-hour interview with Ruby and said she was going to break the Kennedy case wide open, found dead in her apartment of an apparent overdose of alcohol and barbiturates.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Karen Bennett Carlin, another Carousel entertainer who reported seeing hate-ad signer Bernard Weissman at Ruby's club and was the last known person to speak to Ruby before he shot Oswald, died of gunshot wounds in the head in Houston.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Rose Cherami, another Carousel stripper who told a psychiatrist Kennedy had to be killed two days before it happened and who said she'd seen Oswald at Ruby's club many times, killed in a hit-and-run car accident near Big Sandy, Texas.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: Tom Howard, Ruby's attorney who met with Senator and others after Oswald's death, died of a heart attack after 'acting strangely' for two days, no autopsy performed.

Death associated with Kennedy assassination: William Whaley, Dallas cab driver who took Oswald from the Book Depository to his rooming house after the assassination, killed in an auto accident - the first on-duty cabbie death in Dallas since 1937.
Durham involved in various Mafia activities and acts as informer for police, possibly CIA.
Early prison behaviour modification program, CASE, begins in Washington, D.C., boys school.
Fifth UFO flap year.
Fighting in Vietnam escalates into major war.
On the day Malcolm was killed, Pio Ghana de Pinto, who had been working with him to coordinate poor Americans and Third World Africans, was machine-gunned at his home in Africa.
Three Russian scientists report receiving unexplained signals from space.
US Army explores sites in the Middle East, for potential locations for nuclear devices intended to set off earthquakes.
Army simulated germ warfare project in New York City.
Assassination of J.T.V. Ironsi Aquiyi of Nigeria and Hendrick F. Verwoerd of South Africa.
Assassination of Sir Abubakar Balewa of Nigeria.
Attempted assassination of James Meredith in US.
Bilderberger meeting in Wiesbaden, Germany.
CIA begins weather modification experiments over Cuba, later used in an attempt to ruin Castro's sugar cane crop.
E. Howard Hunt serves as CIA contact in assassination plot against Castro.
Retired naval Lt. William Pitzer, who had photographed the secret JFK autopsy and was beginning a job with a TV station, found dead with a bullet in his head.
Approximate date La Costa Resort hotel built near San Clemente, California: meeting place of Mob figures, Teamsters, politicians and other big-wigs.
Assassination of American Nazi George Lincoln Rockwell in Virginia.
Australian Prime Minister disappears while swimming.
Beginning of CIA's $21 million rain-making program over Indochina which would make 2,600 sorties by 1972.
Beginning of Clay Shaw trial; DA Jim Garrison subpoenas Allen Dulles and ex-CIA employee Gordon Novel to testify; both escape testimony.
Bilderberger meeting in Cambridge, England.
Black Panther party formed.
Che Guevara killed in Bolivia after CIA questioning.
CIA's Operation Phoenix, which was to assassinate and torture over 40,000 in Vietnam, officially launched.

Deaths associated with Kennedy assassination: David Ferrie, who was to be a key witness in the trial of Clay Shaw, found dead in his locked apartment in New Orleans, ruled suicide though how the ruptured blood vessel which induced his brain hemorrhage could be self-inflicted was unexplained.

Deaths associated with Kennedy assassination: Eladio del Valle, a friend of Ferrie's who had hired him to fly bombing missions over Cuba, found shot through the heart in a parking lot in Miami, Florida, the same day Ferrie was killed. Dr. Mary Sherman, another friend of Ferrie, shot in New Orleans, her body partially burned by her killer.
Deaths associated with Kennedy assassination: Jack Ruby, whose lawyers charged Dallas authorities with neglecting his health, died of cancer while awaiting retrial.
Jim Thompson, ex-OSS commando and 'Silk King of Thailand,' disappears on Easter Sunday; five months later his sister is murdered.
Military takeover of Greece allegedly executed by secret Operation Prometheus.

Rex Heflin again visited by MIB in connection with his photos of California UFOs; similar MIB incidents in New York and elsewhere; another MIB, Mr. Dixsun, allegedly visits Colorado University UFO researcher Edward Condon and offers to help him contact the space people.
Winthrop Rockefeller elected governor of Arkansas.
Approximate date group called The Kaisers founded - 60 German-Americans allegedly planning to make Nixon a dictator.
Assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., in Memphis, Tennessee, and Robert Kennedy in Los Angeles, California.
Astronauts circling the moon interrupted by unexplained voices.
Behaviour modification token economy program set up in West Virginia youth centre.
Bilderberger meeting in Mont Tremblant, Canada.
CIA penetrates the Students for a Democratic Society at Columbia College; National Caucus of Labour Committees (NCLC) formed within the SDS.
Congress creates LEAA to fund state and local police programs.
Continental drift theory confirmed.

Dr. Nicholas Chetta, who performed autopsies on Ferrie and Dr. Sherman, died of an apparent heart attack; Richard Carr, JFK assassination witness about to testify in the Clay Shaw trial, learns police have arrested a man planning to shoot him.
FBI begins secret Cointelpro campaign against New Left and black radicals.

FBI informer William O'Neal infiltrates Chicago Black Panthers, becomes chief of security, Los Angeles police establish Criminal Conspiracy Section which employs Donald DeFreeze, Louis Tackwood, Ron Karenga, the Steiner brothers and other agents to infiltrate prison reform and black power groups.
Following King assassination black leader Ron Karenga meets secretly with California Governor Reagan and later with Los Angeles police chief Thomas Reddin.

King assassination: James Earl Ray begins international travels thanks to 'Raoul' who sounds very much like his younger brother Jerry Ray; FBI begins search for Ray as lone assassin, ignoring considerable evidence of a conspiracy with Ray as patsy - including reports of the mysterious 'sausage and eggs man' who was seen in the neighbourhood of King's motel with a rifle before and after the murder.
Mystery ship Scheersberg disappears between Antwerp and Genoa with 200 tons of uranium believed to have been taken to Israel.
New York police BOSS unit founds local Black Panther party using undercover agents.
Nixon and Agnew elected.

Robert Kennedy assassination: Sirhan Sirhan, who wounded Kennedy in the shoulder pad, still doesn't remember what happened but perhaps security guard Eugene Cesar, who carried the same calibre gun as Sirhan, does; Kennedy was shot in the back of the head at close range - Cesar was close behind him, Sirhan several feet in front; a 'girl in the polka dot dress,' who earlier had been seen with Sirhan, reportedly leaves the scene saying 'We've shot him!'

Spiro Agnew's law-n-order handling of riots following King's assassination brings him to national attention; Agnew allegedly chosen for Nixon's vice-president to obtain CIA and Greek oil and shipping firms' contributions.
UFOlogists Steiger, Whitenour and Keel smeared during MIB visits in UFO flap area.
Unexplained distress signals from the mid-Pacific received by radio stations, no ships found during search.

Alleged CIA spy Humberto Carrillo Colon arrested by Cuban government which seized his Very Low Frequency transceiver and coded messages describing strange lights, a mini submarine and other unexplained items.
Assassination of Tom Mboya of Kenya and A.A. Shermarke of Somalia.
Bilderberger meeting in Copenhagen, Denmark.
Black Panther leaders killed in Los Angeles by the Steiner brothers, members of Karenga's United Slaves; Panther headquarters raided by SWAT team.
Chappaquidick accident involving Edward Kennedy; Mary Jo Kopechne dies.
Chicago police and FBI raid Black Panthers, kill Fred Hampton and Mark Clark (who were possibly drugged by O'Neal); a series of earlier clashes had left other Chicago Panthers dead.
CIA-linked Professor Thomas Rika disappears from Boulder, Colorado.
CIA's Colton Westbrook returns from Phoenix program in Vietnam to become involved in Black Culture Association (BCA) program in California prisons.
Clyde Johnson, who had allegedly attended parties with Ferrie, Ruby and Oswald and who was beaten up to keep him from testifying at the Clay Shaw trial, shot to death near Greensburg, Louisiana.
DeFreeze sent to Vacaville, California prison, begins to undergo personality changes.
Fifteen Russian generals die in 'unrelated' incidents within a month's time.
First manned lunar landing.
MIB 'Carlos Allende' visits UFOlogists Jim and Coral Lorenzen in Tucson, gives them a copy of the ONR reprint of Jessup's Case for the UFOs.
New York Panthers indicted for conspiracy.
New York Times reveals secret US bombing of Cambodia; Nixon authorizes phone taps of Kissinger's staff to discover leak.
Nixon issues Executive Order No. 11490 establishing plans for dictatorial control in the event of a 'national emergency.'
Pentagon and Department of Interior researchers study methods of inducing earthquakes by injecting fluids into deep wells.
Richard Carr, while visiting in Atlanta, is attacked by two men with knives.
Trial of Shaw for conspiracy to assassinate JFK; with Jim Garrison's witnesses dead or discredited by CIA or FBI and other government agencies, Shaw was soon found not guilty.
Woodstock rock festival in New York state draws well over half a million.
Approximate date of the 'Korea-gate' scandal: Korean CIA undertakes massive influence-peddling campaign, 50 congressmen accept bribes, links made with Nixon Administration and the Unification Church.
Assassination of union leader Joseph Yablonski and his family in Pennsylvania.
Attempted assassination of Pope Paul VI.

Attorneys Lefcourt in New York and Gary in San Francisco are subject to the first of over 100 unsolved break-ins which take place over the next five years; valuables untouched but sensitive political information taken.
Bilderberger meeting in Bad Ragaz, Switzerland.
FBI/police attacks on Black Panthers in Seattle, Baltimore, New Bedford, Philadelphia, New Orleans, Toledo, Detroit and Carbondale.
Nixon staffers develop the Huston Plan and 'Plumbers Unit' in plot to use police and intelligence agencies at all levels for political purposes.

Personality-altering drug 'Prolexin' administered to 1,093 inmates at Vacaville; Special Programs Unit behaviour mod program begins at Joliet, Illinois, under Dr. Martin Groder; Bureau of Prisons requests funds for Federal Centre for Correctional Research in Butner, North Carolina.
Reuther dies in plane crash under suspicious circumstances.
US Army experts complete a 'mock assassination' project against the president and Congress, demonstrating that determined terrorists could wipe out US leaders through use of chemical of germ warfare.
US invasion of Cambodia; Kent State killings; massive protests.
Westbrook meets DeFreeze; BCA at Vacaville encourages revolutionary ideas and racial hatred in inmates.
'Deprogrammer' Ted Patrick begins kidnapping Jesus Freaks and reconverting them to conventional behaviour.
Assassination of Wasfi Tal of Jordan.
Barker attempts to get plans to building which will house the Democratic Convention.
Bilderberger meeting in Woodstock, Vermont.
Black Panther party in shambles; Cointelpro supposedly disbanded.
Daughter of conspiracy investigator Mae Brussell killed in suspicious car accident.
Electroshock treatments given to hundreds of inmates at Vacaville.
FBI begins (or continues) illegal break-ins, mail-openings and wiretaps, conducted by Squad 47 of the internal security division in search of Weather Underground fugitives.
Future SLA members Camilla Hall and William Wolfe move to Berkley, become involved in radical and prison reform activities.

Hunt hired by White House to gather damaging evidence against Daniel Ellsberg, Edward Kennedy and other 'enemies'; Hunt hires Barker and other Bay of Pigs veterans to make break-in at Ellsberg's psychiatrist's office.
John Keel's Our Haunted Planet discusses more MIB cases.
Pentagon Papers published.
Plumber chief David Young, former Kissinger aid, contacts CIA for psychiatric profile of Ellsberg, referred to Howard Osborn, a possible Oswald link.
White House agent Sergretti meets with FBI, Minutemen and others to plan kidnapping of radicals during the 1972 convention - a plan later scrapped.
Zimbardo's Stanford experiments demonstrating dangers of prisoner/guard role-playing.

A series of dirty tricks eliminates Muskie as presidential contender; Humphrey and Jackson also smeared; Nixon aides and west coast Nazis cooperate in attempt to keep Wallace of California ballot; Hunt ordered to break into Bremer's apartment but refuses.
Agnew allegedly meets Brienguier (Oswald's buddy) in New Orleans.

Alleged murders involving secret funds include Rep. William O. Mills (suicide) and his assistants Col. J. Webster and James Glover; a Mr. Taub, Kalmback employee; Dennis Cossini, alleged CIA contact with Bremer; Lou Russell, security cop employed by McCord Associates; and Mrs. Andrew Topping, wife of man alleged to be plotting assassination of Nixon during 1972 convention.
Assassination of Abeid Karume of Zanzibar.
Attempted assassination of George Wallace in Maryland by 'loner' Art Bremer who had more money than he should and had alleged connections with CIA-types.
Bilderberger meeting in Knokke, Belgium.
Black Abductor, anticipating the Hearst kidnapping, published by unknown California publisher.
CIA attempt to crack columnist Jack Anderson's information source fails.
Death of E. Howard Hunt's wife Dorothy in plane crash while carrying large amount of cash - alleged murder described separately under Flight 553.
Exposure and defeat of planned psychosurgery program at Vacaville; CARE behaviour mod program begins at Marion, Illinois; START program begins at Springfield, Missouri; Joliet unit closed.
ITT scandal forces Republicans to move to Miami.
J. Edgar Hoover dies.
Tackwood alleges that plans are made to disrupt Republican convention in San Diego, declare martial law, assassinate Nixon (or make false attempt).
Thero Wheeler, another alleged police agent, meets DeFreeze at Vacaville; DeFreeze moved to Soledad prison.
Warren Commission dissident Hale Boggs disappears on flight to Alaska.
Watergate break-in; FBI official Charles Bates placed in charge of investigation.
West German authorities produce a skull they say was Martin Bormann's a few days after articles appear with evidence he is alive in Argentina.
William and Emily Harris, Angela and Gary Atwood and others move to Bay area, become involved in radical and prison reform activities.
'Race war' in Bay area culminates in the killing of Dr. Foster which the SLA claims credit for in its first communique.
Agnew resigns.

Assassinations of US diplomats Cleo A. Nobel, Jr., and George C. Moore and Belgian diplomat Guy Eid by Palestinian guerrillas in Khartoum; Richard Sharples of Bermuda, Mohammed Ali Osman of Yemen, Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile, Luis Carrero Blanco of Spain and Dr. Marcus Foster in Oakland, California; assassination of an American Army officer by insurgent group in Iran.
Behaviour mod unit started at El Reno, Oklahoma, prison; START-type program introduced to Maryland public schools by Behaviour Research Institute.
Bilderberger meeting in Saltsjobaden, Sweden.
Blue Dove becomes an FBI agent.
DeFreeze escapes from Soledad; Wheeler escapes from Vacaville.
Durham becomes FBI agent, infiltrates American Indian Movement (AIM), becomes chief of security.
Experiments with implanting electrodes in the brain carried out at Vacaville and elsewhere.
Hunt beaten in his cell before testifying about the Bremer connection.
Kissinger and his deputy General Scowcroft order a series of CIA spying operations in Micronesia.
Liberation of Wounded Knee, South Dakota, by AIM.
Senator Stennis shot in Washington, D.C.
Sidney Gottlieb, head of CIA's LSD and other drug programs, destroys records to hide details of program.
Sixth UFO flap year.
Trilateral Commission founded under the direction of David Rockefeller, with Jimmy Carter and Walter Mondale among the founding members.
